net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data

Class ModelHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data.ModelHelper
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ListModelHelper, TableModelHelper, TreeNodeHelper

    public abstract class ModelHelper
extends Object
    This class provides common functionality to help components work with models. Instances of this class are not thread safe.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected ModelHelper()
      Create a new instance.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected abstract String getIdForElementAt(int index)
      Get the element ID for a given element.
      int getModelIndexFromId(String id, int suggestedElementIndex)
      Finds the model index of an element using the ID previously retrieved from the model.
      protected abstract boolean isElementValid(int index)
      Check if an element exists in the model.
      protected void modelIdsChanged()
      This method should be called when the model changes in such a way that the IDs for elements have changed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModelHelper

        protected ModelHelper()
        Create a new instance.

    • Method Detail

      • getIdForElementAt

        protected abstract String getIdForElementAt(int index)
        Get the element ID for a given element.
        Parameters:
        index - The element index.
        Returns:
        String or null if there is no ID.

      • getModelIndexFromId

        public int getModelIndexFromId(String id,
                      int suggestedElementIndex)
        Finds the model index of an element using the ID previously retrieved from the model. The definition of an element is defined by the implementation.
        Parameters:
        id - The element ID.
        suggestedElementIndex - The possible element index, may be -1 if no suggestion.
        Returns:
        Integer.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if no element is associated with the ID.

      • isElementValid

        protected abstract boolean isElementValid(int index)
        Check if an element exists in the model. It is assumed that if an element exists, all elements with an index less than the given index and greater than or equal to zero are valid.
        Parameters:
        index - The element index.
        Returns:
        true if the element is valid.

      • modelIdsChanged

        protected void modelIdsChanged()
        This method should be called when the model changes in such a way that the IDs for elements have changed. This includes ordering.
